content:
Here are my two wishes for the navbar:

  • remove the stream from the FRB when you're in a topic narrow (and ideally remove the pentagon)
  • have the 14k icon click through to the subscriber UI in "Manage Streams"
"FRB" is our abbreviation for the "floating recipient bar"
And then this is more of a bug report than a feature request--when you click on the description to open search, and then hit escape, we should restore the original view of the navbar.

Steve Howell said:

Here are my two wishes for the navbar:

  • remove the stream from the FRB when you're in a topic narrow (and ideally remove the pentagon)

I am also in favour of both of these points

Steve Howell said:

  • have the 14k icon click through to the subscriber UI in "Manage Streams"

been wanting to do this forever. On it.
Also, I've been thinking, the entire | # design |(with padding) should be clickable and not just the text design

Steve Howell said:

"FRB" is our abbreviation for the "floating recipient bar"

Personally I prefer to just always type out "floating recipient bar"; in a large community, abbreviations are a bad trade in saving a bit of time typing something vs. making it a lot harder to understand for folks who don't know the expansion.
I agree on all of those points, though I think we will want to keep the pentagon in the floating recipient bar for readability.
